chapter.title: Gentile
chapter.para:
You've probably heard that the proper word for non-Jew is gentile. This is historically and halachically
Halachah is the rulings of Torah that are followed wrong. The word gentile was not created by Judaism. It is a word used by Romans from the Latin language generally used to describe non-Roman citizens.

sect1.title: History
sect1.para:
Gentile is from the Latin word gentilis.
gentīlis m, f (neuter gentīle)
of or belonging to the same family or gēns
of who bore the same name as their master
(poetic) foreign, exotic
of or belonging to the same people or nation

Gentile was used to denote anyone not of Roman citizenship and from a clan or tribe: a barbarian. At this time, the literal word gentile was never used in the Jewish vernacular. The closest term Jews had to denote non-Jews of other tribes, clans, or peoples, was the word goy, which we'll talk about in the next chapter.

Not only can bnei Noach do more, although not mandatory, bnei Noach are also halachically separate than the goy stam(plain goy)(Hilchot Melachim 10:10) who is an idolator(A"KUM)(Hilchot Ma'achalot Assurot 11:8). They are different dea’ot - containers of logic.
If a ben Noach who observes the sheva mitzvot bnei Noach gives charity, we should accept it from him. It appears to me that it should be given to the Jewish poor for the ben Noach may derive his sustenance from the Jews and they are commanded to support him if necessary. In contrast, if a goy gives charity, we should accept it from him and give it to the goy poor." - Rambam, Hilchot Melachim 10:10 (from the Yemenite unedited)

sect1.title: Responsa
sect1.para: The gentile must stay a gentile
The gentile must stay a gentile and be a servant the ger toshav can own Jewish slaves. This is a major reason why the Yovel year must be in place in order to accept gerim toshvim
